thought: The first step is to paste the lines into a new document. I will use the paste action to insert the text into the editor.
The next step is to place the caret at line 3. I will move the mouse to the approximate location of line 3 and click to place the caret there.

The previous attempt to place the caret on line 3 failed. I will try again, but this time I will move the mouse slightly higher, closer to the line number 3, before clicking. The bounding box for 'Test' on line 3 is [0.05922309309244156, 0.23267169296741486, 0.09743697196245193, 0.25609999895095825].

The previous attempt to place the caret on line 3 failed again. I will try placing the cursor on line 3 by moving to the line number '3' and clicking there. I don't see the line numbers in the parsed content, so I will try moving to the beginning of the line and slightly to the left of the word 'Test'.

Since clicking on the text 'Test' and 'new' did not place the caret on line 3, I will try moving the caret to the beginning of the document and then pressing the down arrow key twice to move it to line 3. I don't see any UI element to move the cursor to the beginning of the document, so I will use hotkey Ctrl+Home to move the cursor to the beginning of the document.
Now that the caret is on line 3, the next step is to go to View -> Hide Lines. I will move the mouse to the View menu and click it.
Now that the View menu is open, I need to click on 'Hide Lines'. I will move the mouse to the 'Hide Lines' option in the View menu and click it.
The next step is to place the caret at line 2. I will use the hotkeys Ctrl+Home to move the cursor to the beginning of the document and then press the down arrow key once to move it to line 2.
Now that the caret is on line 2, the next step is to go to View -> Hide Lines. I will move the mouse to the View menu and click it.
Now that the View menu is open, I need to click on 'Hide Lines'. I will move the mouse to the 'Hide Lines' option in the View menu and click it.
Now that the View menu is open, I need to click on 'Hide Lines'. I will move the mouse to the 'Hide Lines' option in the View menu and click it.

The next step is to click on the show-lines markers. Based on the current UI observation, fold markers are visible next to lines 1 and 4. I will move the mouse to the fold marker next to line 1 and click it.
The next step is to click on the single show-lines marker. Since I clicked on the show-lines marker next to line 1 in the previous step, I will now click on the show-lines marker next to line 4.
